item.title: Hillsborough: Fan injured in stadium disaster dies 32 years later
item.description: Andrew Devine's family say the coroner's ruling confirms him as the 97th victim of the 1989 tragedy.

item.title: Vishal Mehrotra: Police scrapped plans for schoolboy murder appeal
item.description: The father of a murdered boy says a police decision not to appeal for information is "disgusting".

item.title: Author of Christmas letter to Santa found by Worksop chimney sweeps revealed
item.description: Robert William Crampton said he is hoping to be reunited with the hopeful note penned on his behalf.

item.title: Covid vaccine: Thorpe Park in Surrey opens pop-up clinic
item.description: Visitors to Thorpe Park are able to get vaccinated at a pop-up clinic.

item.title: European bison rangers chosen for Kent woodland herd
item.description: The European bison will restore a rich habitat for local wildlife when they are introduced in 2022.

item.title: Mikey Poulli: The young blind footballer backed by star players
item.description: Mikey Poulli, who lost his sight due to a rare degenerative condition, dreams of playing for England.

item.title: Bury Council left vulnerable boy without education for 10 months
item.description: Bury Council, which admitted "a number of failures", has paid compensation to the family.

item.title: Bolton death: Murder arrest after man's body found in home
item.description: Police are treating the death of 46-year-old David Jones in Bolton as "unexplained".

item.title: London anti-Semitism increased as Middle East tensions grew
item.description: Violence against Jewish people in London rose as tensions grew in the Middle East, new figures show.

item.title: Honour for unsung 'creator of cinema' William Friese-Greene
item.description: A series of events are being held to highlight the impact William Friese-Greene had on film.

item.title: Lily Parr: Unseen photos show first women's football stars
item.description: They show superstar striker Lily Parr and her teammates at the height of their success in the 1930s.

item.title: Covid: Which children are being vaccinated and why?
item.description: Hundreds of thousands of children at higher risk from coronavirus infection will be offered a Covid vaccine in the UK.

item.title: Why you shouldn't get a second Covid jab too early
item.description: A government scientific advisor tells Newsbeat why four weeks is too soon between Covid jabs.

item.title: Beta coronavirus variant: What is the risk?
item.description: There are fears that this version of coronavirus, first identified in South Africa, is

item.title: Covid rules: How can the clinically vulnerable stay safe?
item.description: As social-distancing and other Covid rules end in England, how can people who were shielding stay safe?

item.title: What are the rules and guidance for face masks and coverings from 19 July?
item.description: Masks are no longer compulsory in England, but remain necessary in Scotland and Wales.

item.title: Leicester asylum seeker: 'My allotment saved my life'
item.description: Joel Chitsa says gardening helped deal with the pain of being forced to leave Zimbabwe.

item.title: 'I wouldn't pay Â£4 to walk up a hill'
item.description: The public reacts to London's newest tourist attraction, which is facing complaints of being incomplete.

item.title: Birmingham 2022: Drones light show mark one year to go
item.description: The skies of Birmingham were lit up to mark a year until the city hosts the Commonwealth Games.

item.title: Terminally-ill Rotherham mum on fight for life and family
item.description: Mum-of-two Helen Davy received the diagnosis four years after her husband's death.

item.title: Channel crossings: RNLI release footage of rescue
item.description: The video shows about 12 people, including young children, in a dinghy being pulled to safety.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Mallory Franklin wins canoe slalom silver as shooter Matthew Coward-Holley wins trap bronze
item.description: Mallory Franklin wins canoe slalom silver and shooter Matthew Coward-Holley wins trap bronze for Team GB on day six of the Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Mallory Franklin wins silver medal in women's canoe slalom
item.description: Britain's Mallory Franklin wins a silver medal in the women's canoe slalom at the Tokyo Olympics.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Matthew Coward-Holley takes shooting bronze for Great Britain
item.description: Matthew Coward-Holley claims Great Britain's 17th medal of the Tokyo Olympics with bronze in the men's trap shooting final.
